title: How to Make a Chocolate Cookie Sundae

steps.headline: Place each ingredient, one by one, into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Whisk at a slow speed and eventually increase to a medium speed. Turn the mixer off every so often to scrape off the sides. This will allow the ingredients that are whipped to the sides to still be whisked evenly.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into a plastic storage container and place it in the refrigerator to chill for 2 hours or in the freezer for 30 minutes.
Use a small ice cream scooper or spoon and create cookie dough balls on a greased cookie sheet.
steps.description: Place it in the oven for 10 minutes at 265 °F (129 °C).

steps.headline: Melt the butter and the chocolate chips over medium heat in a saucepan.
steps.description: Stir constantly so that the mixture does not burn. Add the sugar and vanilla and stir mixture completely.

steps.headline: Slowly add the half & half cream.
steps.description: Simmer and stir the fudge mixture for 18 minutes. If the mixture gets too bubbly, turn down the heat. After the 18 minutes, remove from the heat and place it on the side to cool down.

steps.headline: Place a cookie on a plate and a generous scoop of ice cream on top of the cookie.
Drizzle the hot fudge and nuts on top as droppings.

text: Cookie Place each ingredient, one by one, into a mixing bowl. Whisk at a slow speed and eventually increase to a medium speed. Turn the mixer off every so often to scrape off the sides. This will allow the ingredients that are whipped to the sides to still be whisked evenly. Pour the batter into a plastic storage container and place it in the refrigerator to chill for 2 hours or in the freezer for 30 minutes.  Use a small ice cream scooper or spoon and create cookie dough balls on a greased cookie sheet. Place it in the oven for 10 minutes at 265 °F (129 °C). Fudge Melt the butter and the chocolate chips over medium heat in a saucepan. Stir constantly so that the mixture does not burn. Add the sugar and vanilla and stir mixture completely. Slowly add the half & half cream. Simmer and stir the fudge mixture for 18 minutes. If the mixture gets too bubbly, turn down the heat. After the 18 minutes, remove from the heat and place it on the side to cool down. Creating the Sundae Place a cookie on a plate and a generous scoop of ice cream on top of the cookie.  Drizzle the hot fudge and nuts on top as droppings.
